quest.name: Our Compromise
journal: You knew from the first that there was only one way this could end.

Sid has at last accepted that Myste is not coming back to Ishgard, and that if we are to reclaim the remainder of our stolen aether, we will need to take the initiative. Rhalgr's Reach was the last place you spoke, and so that is where we will go.

In speaking with the people of Rhalgr's Reach, we learn that Myste stayed there for a time, asking questions of a conjurer regarding aether and perhaps being responsible for the mysterious deaths of several chocobos. He's been naughty, to say the least.

Sid is unsure what to make of what we learned, though it seems fairly obvious to me what mischief the boy's been about. And you too, I hope. Anyway, it would seem that Myste was seen leaving the Reach and heading towards the Peaks. The hunt is on!

Two beasts, dead, with no discernable injuries. Now where have we heard that before? Sid finally realizes that the boy must have sucked them dry of their aether, in the same way that he stole our aether. Needless to say, he is far, far more dangerous than he appears. A pity it took you all this long to see it.
Wrong way, wrong way! He'll kill Sid and Rielle if we don't hurry!

And now, the betrayal. Myste believes that the only way we can atone for our sins is to “undo” them with his simulacra. Every life we took, every death that weighs upon our soul, he would make amends for it all with his beautiful lies. I can end this charade, godsdammit, I can end it! Now is the time! You need me! YOU NEED ME!

...So it goes. If you would not forsake me, then of course you would not forsake him. And so...neither can I. He is a fool, but he is our little fool. The little girlboy who wanted to make this cruel, twisted world a better place, futile as that is. SheHe's going to get us killed one of these days...but what can I say? I love herhim. I forgive herhim. And you...

Do you recall how we came to this place? At a friend's behest, in the midst of a raging blizzard? As we drew closer the gates faded into vision, and the towering spires...the man bowed low and bade us follow him, up the winding stair, from still smoldering ruin to untouched splendor. There we found a warm home and warm hearth, and warm hearts...

At the Last Vigil, as you reflect once more on the path you have walked, you are surprised by Lord Edmont, who greets you warmly. News of your exploits is delivered to Fortemps Manor daily, and you remain always in the thoughts of the former count and his family. Though a part of him wishes that you would remain in Ishgard, he knows that your destiny leads you elsewhere, for you are still a hero. You are still a good person.

※The next dark knight quest will be available from Sidurgu once you have met the following requirements:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”
※ You must have completed the role quest “To Have Loved and Lost.”
objectives: Search the Last Forest for Myste.
Return to where it all began.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to undertake this quest, you must first complete the main scenario quest “A Familiar Face Forgotten.”

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...Godsdammit, Myste. We're going to have to track him down and make him return the remainder of the aether he stole from you, aren't we?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: He said that when this was finished, naught would remain of him. Bloody vague and ominous, to say the least...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: We'll just have to press him for answers when we find him.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: You last saw him at Rhalgr's Reach in Gyr Abania, yes? We'll start there.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: I'm going too, and I won't take no for an answer. Sid's gotten better, but he's a long way from fully recovered. Besides, you'll need someone else to help you do the talking. Sid's no good at it.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: What are you waiting for? Clearly I'm no good at making small talk, so you and Rielle will have to ask after Myste.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Someone here has to know something that can lead us to Myste...

dialogue.name: GILOW
dialogue.text: Lot of unusual folks coming through the Reach these days...

dialogue.name: GATEKEEPER02919
dialogue.text: Looking for a young boy with long blue hair, you say? Reckon I would remember someone like that if they were to come this way. And I don't.

dialogue.name: GATEKEEPER02919
dialogue.text: Spoke with the fella before me during the changing of the guard, as we do, and he made no mention of anyone matching that description either...

dialogue.name: GATEKEEPER02919
dialogue.text: I'm not saying the boy didn't come this way, but I'd be surprised if he had. Someone would have noted his passing and told the others.

dialogue.name: ORELLA
dialogue.text: ...Ah, yes, I remember the long-haired boy. Very curious, with many questions about the nature of aether. He conversed with one of the Adder conjurers for a time. I know not what they discussed, but from his expression I gathered it was important.

dialogue.name: ORELLA
dialogue.text: Very mature for his age, the boy. And somehow ethereal...

dialogue.name: BREEDER02919
dialogue.text: Hm? What's that!? You're looking for that boy too, are you!?

dialogue.name: BREEDER02919
dialogue.text: I was watching some birds late the other night when I hear someone skulking about behind me. “Forgive me, forgive me,” I hear him saying, before he runs off and disappears into the dark.

dialogue.name: BREEDER02919
dialogue.text: Then I realize it's quiet─too quiet, aye? Sleeping birds make noise, and mine ain't. 'Cause they're dead. Every last one of them. No wounds or any other obvious marks, but there they lay, like the life was sucked right out of them!

dialogue.name: BREEDER02919
dialogue.text: I don't know how or why he did it, but there's no denying that he did! I demand recompense! If you find him, you bring him to me!

dialogue.name: BREEDER02919
dialogue.text: Wait─are you that boy's keeper? Are you responsible for him!? 'Cause if you are, you owe me an explanation!

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: I have a bad feeling about this. I hope Myste hasn't done something stupid...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Our inspector returns. Tell us, have you learned aught of Myste's whereabouts?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...Seen conversing with a conjurer and possibly killing chocobos? Not sure what to make of that. Though we can be sure he stayed here for a time.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: But perhaps no longer. We learned but moments ago from Gilow here that a boy matching Myste's description was seen leaving the Reach.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: He is for the Peaks. And so are we.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: They're dead. Just...dead. Like the chocobos in the story you heard.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: No visible injuries, no bleeding. Aye, it is as Rielle says: these beasts died for no discernable reason. Just like the chocobos that man in the Reach claims Myste somehow killed.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: But it doesn't add up. Other than his singular magick, Myste was utterly helpless. Unless...was he always capable of this?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...But we know the answer already. He stole your aether when we first met.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Even if he could do it, even if he did do it...why?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: We'll ask him when we find him. And this time, you'll let me do the talking.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Search the east. Rielle and I will head south. We'll meet in between if we find naught, and if we do...either you will come to our aid, or we to yours.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: As you survey your surroundings, you observe naught out of the ordinary...but on the edge of hearing, you hear a whisper to the southwest...

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: No... Mother...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Seven hells, I hate being right...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: On your guard. Myste has shown his true colors. The aether or whatever else he took from those beasts has given him tremendous strength...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Contrary to his earlier warnings, conjuring another simulacrum wasn't the end of him. And of all the wonderful people he had to pluck from our memories, he chose Ystride de Caulignont.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: He knows why we're here, and this is his answer. He summoned the monster that haunts Rielle in her dreams and sends her screaming from her bed.

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Sid, but you gave me no choice...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Say your name. Your real name!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: There is always a choice.

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text:
...Shall I ask you the same? Who holds the reins? Though it matters not.
We are complicit, you and I.

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: ...No. There isn't. Not really.

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: Can you even remember why you came here? Can you even remember how many you killed? How many lives shattered, how many stories ended?

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: Upon the surface of the crystal are carved the sins of dark knights past...and yours are beyond counting. Beyond fathoming. Without end.

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: Justice is an excuse. Nobility is a lie. Murder is murder!

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: And though we are most definitely not without fault, it is this cruel, indifferent world which has made murderers of us all.

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: But we need suffer no longer. I sought to make these broken souls whole, one by one, when in truth the solution was much more simple.

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: A world beyond pain and suffering and anguish and despair─a world beyond death! A world in which we never need bid farewell to our dearest friends.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: And how many beasts will you need to kill to make this world of yours? How much aether will you consume to see it through? Bloody self-righteous sophistry from a mewling whelp...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: So your brilliant plan is to fill the world with simulacra of the dead, is it? And somehow that's supposed to make everyone happy?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Well, you're right about one thing, I'll grant you that. This world is brutal, uncaring, without logic or justice...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: No justice but that which we make for ourselves! And I'll be damned if I give it up so you can force your illusions upon us to assuage your guilt!

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: Did you not find comfort in your reunion with your master!? Even though you knew it was a lie, did it not help you to unburden your soul? To find a measure of peace in this madness!?

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: I am not your enemy. Not then or now. I will not fight you. All I ask is that you leave me to do my duty.

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text:
It's never too late to turn back. You are still a good person.
You can still be...a good person...

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: So this is your answer...

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: Maybe you cannot accept what needs to be done. But I can. Good-bye.

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: So many broken by this world, and then by you. So, so many...

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: Woe betide the man who stands opposed to the Weapon of Light, for death will be his reward. Death for him and his kin and all that he holds dear.

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: Woe betide the man who stands with the Weapon of Light, for death will be his reward. Death for him and his kin and all that he holds dear.

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: Like sands through the hourglass, everything we fight so desperately to protect slips through our fingers...and what remains...what remains...

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: ...Is us. Only us, and the memory of our sin.

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: To walk this path is to suffer. To sacrifice...

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: (Listen to my voice. Listen to our heartbeat...)

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: ...Justice demands no less.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: I tire of this charade.

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: (-???-)Serve... Save... Slave... Slay... I've sins aplenty, aye, but regrets? Not so much.

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: (-???-)And if shehe wouldn't listen to me, the embodiment of good sense and pragmatism, then what hope could you possibly have?

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: (-???-)A house divided cannot stand, you know. This childish rebellion ends now.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: What in the seven hells is this!?

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: ...A compromise, I suppose? Our dear friend here refused to let me take the reins, but I wasn't about to stand idly by while that imbecile tries to do...whatever it was he was trying to do.

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: No hard feelings about Whitebrim, eh? Promise not to stab you in the back.

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: It'll be just like old times.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: A dark knight needs a sword. Take mine.

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: No... No... This is wrong... This is all wrong...

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: I offer you peace! Restitution! A chance to make amends! Do not think you are above it! Do not think that a reckoning will be postponed indefinitely!

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: When it comes, I shall welcome it with open arms...

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: But today will not be the day, and you will not be the judge!

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: Forgive me, forgive me... I ask, I beg, I pray, but it never comes...

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: Again they go to join the multitude in the black oblivion of the abyss...

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: Such is our lot. Such is the fate of all who are born─to suffer and to die.

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: Do not seek forgiveness, for it will not ease the burden. It weighs as it should.

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: But what of the lost? Do they not deserve to live again?

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: They do. In our hearts and our souls and our memories.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: No one likes having to say good-bye. But it's...it's a part of life. That's what makes the time we share together so precious...

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: You can't obsess over the mistakes of the past, or you'll lose sight of the future. Of the people still with us, who need us more than ever.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: The greatest strength is born of the flame in the abyss...

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text:
Listen to my voice. Listen to our heartbeat. Listen...
I forgive you. I forgive you. I forgive you...

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: Thank you. That is...that is all I ever wanted...

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: So...this is it. One last parting. One final farewell...after a fashion.

dialogue.name: MYSTE
dialogue.text: In your darkest hour, in the blackest night...think of me...and I will be with you. Always. For where else could I go? Who else could I love but you?

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Ah...you're back. Welcome home...?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: You'll forgive us for returning to Ishgard ahead of you, I hope. I, uh...needed some time to think on everything that happened in Gyr Abania.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: I won't pretend to know everything you've been through in your life. A man can never truly understand what's in another's heart...and probably not their own, for that matter...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: I'm pretty much rambling at this point, but...I suppose what I'm trying to say is that I'm grateful for everything you've done for me and Rielle. I like you. I respect you. And I'll always be here for you, if you need me.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: We're fellow walkers of the path, after all. And friends, I'd like to think.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: I've been wondering... Myste appeared at the same time the soul crystal cracked, yes? But which happened first? And why then and there?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Damned if I know. Does anyone truly understand how soul crystals work? What matters is that the crystal and Forename have been made whole.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: That said... “A heart bleeds, a man weeps, a soul burns. Thence comes the darkness, to consume.” And few hearts have bled as much as hershis...

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Speaking of bleeding, I think your wounds have reopened. If you would sit, it would be much easier for me to tend to them...

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: You should get some rest too, Forename. Not all wounds are so obvious.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Out of the mouths of babes and sucklings─praise Halone! She's right, though. No need to overdo it by running off to the next battle just yet.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: If you must put one foot in front of the other, though, why don't you go back to where this whole damn mess began? Maybe you'll have an epiphany.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Part of me can't help but think this was all a fever dream. And then I take a deep breath and feel the pain in my ribs...

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: It's nice to dream of a world without pain and suffering. But the world is what it is, and dreams will only carry you so far. That's why we've got swords.

dialogue.name: EDMONT
dialogue.text: (-???-)Hm? What troubles you, MistressMaster Surname?

dialogue.name: EDMONT
dialogue.text: Ah, but of course. 'Tis bitterly cold this day. At times like these, one should be warming themselves by the fire.

dialogue.name: EDMONT
dialogue.text: Not a day goes by without your name being spoken, you know. The soldiers and merchants often bring us news of your latest exploits. That said, to hear it from the hero herselfhimself would be much preferable...

dialogue.name: EDMONT
dialogue.text: But there would be no expectation were you to call on us. The pleasure of your company alone would be more than enough.

dialogue.name: EDMONT
dialogue.text: Rare though I expect it will be in the days to come... But your destiny was never to remain here, was it? Though a part of me wishes that you would...

dialogue.name: EDMONT
dialogue.text: Forgive me. I find myself growing more and more sentimental in my old age...and in working on my memoirs, I have had to reflect on the darker chapters of my life...

dialogue.name: EDMONT
dialogue.text: Haurchefant...lived his to the fullest...and if his story is preserved for generations to come, then I...I should be glad of it...

dialogue.name: EDMONT
dialogue.text: You will always have a place here, Forename. For you are family. Now, go! Do not let me keep you from your labors. The world waits for none─not even you.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the dark knight quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Stormblood. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the role quest “To Have Loved and Lost.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next dark knight quest will be available from Sidurgu.
